sen.j: シドニー号事件（シドニーごうじけん）は、日清戦争のとき、日仏2国間で問題となった事件。
sen.e: This incident occurred between Japan and France during The Sino-Japanese War

sen.j: 中立国船舶の乗客である中立国人が戦時禁制人として逮捕され、戦時国際法上の一例となった。
sen.e: This incident ultimately set one example of international relationship during a warfare, as the individual who showed neutrality to the war has been arrested as a "forbidden" person.

This incident ultimately set one example in the application of international law in time of war, as a passenger from a neutral country on a neutral ship was arrested as a "forbidden" person in wartime.

sen.j: 明治27年10月、日清戦争のさなか、ワイルド、カメロンとそれぞれ称するアメリカ人2名が、ワシントン駐箚の中国公使館員とともに、ゲーリック号の乗客として、横浜に寄港した。
sen.e: In October of Meiji 27', two American passengers called Wild and Cameron, along with Chinese legation staff from the state of Washington, arrived at Yokohama by Gehrig fleet during The Sino-Japanese War
In October 1894, during The Sino-Japanese War, two American passengers called Wild and Cameron, along with Chinese legation staff of Washington, arrived at Yokohama on a vessel, Gehrig.

sen.e: In October 1894, during The Sino-Japanese War, two American passengers called Wild and Cameron, along with Chinese legation staff of Washington, arrived at Yokohama on a vessel, Gehrig.

sen.j: 彼らは水雷の製造者で、日本海軍を攻撃する意図をもって、中国政府との契約により渡中する旨の報がつたえられたから、日本官憲は、同船を臨検したところ、2名は既に、フランスと極北諸港間の航路に就航するフランス船シドニー号に移乗し、神戸経由上海に行こうとしていた。
sen.e: Because Japanese officials found out that these two were producers of water mines, and that they had an intention of attacking Japanese Navy by their contract with Chinese government, their fleet went under the investigation, only to find out that they were already on aboard in Sydney fleet of France bounded for Shanghai via Kobe.

Because Japanese officials found out that these two were producers of underwater mines and had an intention of attacking Japanese Navy by their contract with Chinese government, they conducted a search on the vessel, only to find out that the two were already aboard a French vessel, Sydney, bounded for Shanghai via Kobe.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿って修正しました。
sen.e: Because Japanese officials found out that these two were producers of underwater mines and had an intention of attacking Japanese Navy by their contract with Chinese government, they conducted a search on the vessel, only to find out that the two were already aboard a French vessel, Sydney, bounded for Shanghai via Kobe.

sen.j: 日本海軍は、神戸において同船を臨検し、物的証拠を得たから、2名を戦時禁制人として逮捕し、同船を解放した。
sen.e: Japanese Navy again investigated the Sydney and discovered some material evidences; Two American were thus arrested and the fleet was released.
Japanese Navy again investigated the Sydney at Kobe and discovered some material evidences; two American were thus arrested and the fleet was released.

sen.e: Japanese Navy again investigated the Sydney at Kobe and discovered some material evidences; two American were thus arrested and the fleet was released.

sen.j: 本件に関しては船長ならびにフランス領事の抗議を受け、国際法学者の間にも種々、論議があったが、要するに、本件は、ただ敵国のために軍事上の任務に従事するもののみならず、従事しようとする企図のあるものをも処分する例を開いたものとなった。
sen.e: Although many international lawyers, captain of fleet, as well as the French consulate all proclaimed the protest for this exceptional action, this incident pioneered an example of punishing not only those who obviously engaged in hostile military, but also those who merely intend to be attentive to the war.

Although captain of fleet as well as the French consulate proclaimed the protest for this exceptional action, and there were many arguments amont many international law experts, this incident pioneered an example of punishing not only those who are obviously on military duty of hostile country, but also those who merely intend to be involved in.
